name: geographicCoverage
column4: Information on the geographic coverage of the data. Includes the total geographic scope of the data.

name: country
column4: The country or nation that the Dataset is about.

name: state
column4: The state or province that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.

name: city
column4: The name of the city that the Dataset is about. Use GeoNames for correct spelling and avoid abbreviations.

name: otherGeographicCoverage
column4: Other information on the geographic coverage of the data.

name: geographicUnit
column4: Lowest level of geographic aggregation covered by the Dataset, e.g., village, county, region.

name: geographicBoundingBox
column4: The fundamental geometric description for any Dataset that models geography is the geographic bounding box. It describes the minimum box, defined by west and east longitudes and north and south latitudes, which includes the largest geographic extent of the  Dataset's geographic coverage. This element is used in the first pass of a coordinate-based search. Inclusion of this element in the codebook is recommended, but is required if the bound polygon box is included.

name: westLongitude
column4: Westernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= West  Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.

name: eastLongitude
column4: Easternmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -180,0 <= East Bounding Longitude Value <= 180,0.

name: northLongitude
column4: Northernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= North Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.

name: southLongitude
column4: Southernmost coordinate delimiting the geographic extent of the Dataset. A valid range of values,  expressed in decimal degrees, is -90,0 <= South Bounding Latitude Value <= 90,0.
